result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter D Blake

defendant.name: Blake, Peter D
defendant.address: 9226 West Mitchell Street, West Allis, WI 53214

records.addlTxt: For reasons stated on the record, Court granted Atty. Lee's motion to withdraw.

Defendant Peter D Blake not in court.  Attorney May Y Lee appeared by video for Peter D Blake.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Case set for status conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Peter D Blake in court with attorney May Y Lee.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held via zoom. Attorney Lee withdraws motion to withdraw. Parties are pursuing a DPA offer, Attorney Lee is requesting additional time to review with defendant. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Adjustment Number: 22A 071424,
Payable Number: 1022551,
Receipt Number: 22RP030347,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Peter D Blake in court with attorney May Y Lee.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held via Zoom. Defense motion to dismiss the complaint heard. For reasons stated on the record motion is denied.  Atty. Lee has not received discovery or an offer and would like a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07/08/2022 IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any Menards.

Defendant Peter D Blake in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 1.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-6-2022 @2:30p
